venue.name: Rabb Auditorium at Boston Public Library in Copley Square

item.description:
Mitch Zuckoff, author of All About Altman, will be introducing the first film or film excerpt in this series. This "visionary director, hard-partying hedonist, eccentric family man, Hollywood legend comes roaring to life in ...Zuckoff's... rollicking cinematic biography, told in a chorus of voices that can only be called Altmanesque." (BPL website)

I want to see all these films. Here's the complete list. (I will at least host the first and "Gosford Park" and "Nashville" in December.) The youtube excerpt on the first short film is about the French ruling class inviting members of insane asylums to the opera in the 1700's.

Nov. 2 Les Boreades from Aria 10 min. color 1987
Nov. 9 A Prairie Home Companion 105 min. color 2006
Nov. 16 Fool for Love 106 min. color 1985
Nov. 23 Popeye 114 min. color 1980Nov. 30 McCabe and Mrs. Miller 120 min. color 1971
Dec. 7 Gosford Park 137 min. color 2001
Dec. 14 Nashville 159 min. color 1975

Hope you can come.
item.how_to_find_us: After the lecture and short film or film excerpt, I will be holding up a meetup sign just outside the door of Rabb. Since most people have to work next day, let's have a short discussion somewhere. Any suggestions for a place to talk?
item.name: Robert Altman festival introduced by author of a new book about Altman
